Description: Bronze axe-head with angular lugs at concave butt and incurved sides. There are clear traces of the original haft.
Curator's comments: Found in the same grave as 1930,0711.254. Metallographic analysis has indicated that after casting the piece was annealed and finished with cold working. Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 117, 127, pi. LXXVII, II; E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 107, G-I/6.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (104)
